titleStmt.title: Saint Petersburg, The National Library of Russia (Российская национaльная библиотeка), Marcel 125

respStmt.resp: Edited by Michael Marx in collaboration with Tobias J. Jocham et. al. TEI version created by Yasmin Faghihi and Huw Jones

msIdentifier.repository: The National Library of Russia (Российская национaльная библиотeка) , Saint Petersburg

summary.p: 9 fol. on parchment; Shelfmark: Marcel 125; Qurʾānic Text: Q 18:75-18:105; 7 lines per page; Dimensions: 255 x 176mm; Script style: kūfī D.I.
The fragments Marcel 114, Marcel 128 (NLR) and Arabe 348 (c) (BNF) belong to the same manuscript.

This entry was created on the basis of the information made available by Valery V. Polosin (1939-2014), without use of manuscript images. Therefore, the exact distribution of the Qurʾānic passages across the manuscript pages is unknown to us, and all the passages are shown as belonging to fol. 1. The catalogue entry by Polosin contains the following information:
9 fol. 176×255 mm (1.45). Support: thin transparent parchment, smooth, of yellowish color. Writing material: brown ink.
Collation: one incomplete quire, fol. 2 and 9, 4 and 7, 5 and 6 are bifolia, fol. 1 is half of of a bifolium, fol 3 and 8 are singletons with stubs.
H1F H2F H3F S H4F H5F / F6H F7H F8H S F9H.

Text layout: 97/100×163/172 mm (1.666), 7 lines. Ruling: absent. Script: D I, horizontal elements of some letters are stretched up to 6 cm. Diacritics: diagonal dashes in the same ink as the main text. Vocalization: round golden, red and green dots.

Verse markers: for individual verses – small rosettes (type 3.1.2) in gold and colors; for groups of five verses – teardrop-shaped medallions (type. 5.1.1), in gold and colors; for groups of ten verses – large medallions in the text line (type 5.C.II), in gold and colors, with the inscribed verse number (ثمنون – fol. 3r, تسعون – fol. 5v, مائة fol. 8v).
Stitching: threads have been preserved in the punctures of two inner bifolia of the quire.
Inscriptions: numbers of surahs in Roman numerals and the verse numbers in Arabic numerals are inscribed in pencil on the outer margins.
Defects: minor stains; bifolia and stubs have partial tears along the spine; ink has partly peeled off on the flesh sides.

Attached materials: old wrapping (fol. I) consisting of a narrow strip of paper inscribed with the number “№ 5” inscribed in pencil; on the verso side the address “Quai des Grands Augustins 27” is inscribed.
Old accession numbers: № 5 (according to 2nd Langlois’ inventory)
Fol. 1r–9v. Surah 18, verses 74(75)–105(105). Incipit: [شيئاً نكراً] قال ألم أقل لك . Explicit: كفروا بأيات [ربّهم ولقائه] .
Other parts of the same manuscript: Marcel 114, Marcel 128 (NLR); Arabe 348c (BNF)."
Olga Yastrebova has translated and sometimes corrected the notes of V. Polosin. Corrected passages are marked with ОЯ (O.Ya).
